intro: Ilex longifolia, commonly known as the evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe, characterized by its dense, glossy evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Ilex longifolia typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its adaptability to various soil types and climate conditions makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
